headline.main: Italy Lauds 2 Officers as Heroes in Fatal Shooting of Fugitive

snippet: The officers stopped Anis Amri, the Tunisian man wanted in the Berlin truck attack. One officer was shot; another had been on the job for just nine months....
lead_paragraph: The officers stopped Anis Amri, the Tunisian man wanted in the Berlin truck attack. One officer was shot; another had been on the job for just nine months.

snippet: German opinion on immigration is polarized, but stable, after the killing of 12 people at a Christmas market....

headline.print_headline: Uganda Charges Traditional Leader at Center of Unrest With Terrorism
headline.main: Uganda Charges Traditional Leader at Center of Unrest With Terrorism

snippet: A Ugandan traditional leader was charged with terrorism on Tuesday after clashes between his guards and Ugandan security forces last month left at least 62 people dead, court papers seen by Reuters showed....
lead_paragraph: A Ugandan traditional leader was charged with terrorism on Tuesday after clashes between his guards and Ugandan security forces last month left at least 62 people dead, court papers seen by Reuters showed.

headline.print_headline: Berlin Manhunt Ends in Gunfire in Italian Plaza
headline.main: Hunt for Berlin Suspect Ends in Gunfire on an Italian Plaza

snippet: Anis Amri, the 24-year-old Tunisian sought in connection with the rampage that killed 12 people at a Christmas market in Berlin, was killed by Italian police officers....
lead_paragraph: Anis Amri, the 24-year-old Tunisian sought in connection with the rampage that killed 12 people at a Christmas market in Berlin, was killed by Italian police officers.

byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Sesto San Giovanni, Gaia Pianigiani from Rome and Rukmini Callimachi from New York. Reporting was contributed by Franziska Reymann and Alison Smale from Berlin, Sewell Chan from London, Eric Schmitt from Washington and Lorenzo Tondo from Palermo, Italy.
byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO, GAIA PIANIGIANI and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI

headline.print_headline: Afghan President and Trump Discuss Terrorism
headline.main: Afghan President and Trump Discuss Terrorism

lead_paragraph: The Afghan government says U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and Afghan President Ashraf Ghani have emphasized their joint commitment to fighting terrorism in a phone conversation.

headline.print_headline: Pope's Christmas Message Offers Hope in World Hit by Terrorism, War
headline.main: Pope's Christmas Message Offers Hope in World Hit by Terrorism, War

snippet: Pope Francis on Sunday offered a Christmas hope for peace in a world lacerated by war and terrorism, urging people to remember migrants, refugees and those hit by economic instability caused by "idolatry of money"....
lead_paragraph: Pope Francis on Sunday offered a Christmas hope for peace in a world lacerated by war and terrorism, urging people to remember migrants, refugees and those hit by economic instability caused by "idolatry of money".

headline.print_headline: Shaken but Undaunted, Berliners Return to Christmas Markets
headline.main: Shaken but Undaunted, Berliners Return to Christmas Markets

snippet: The market where an attack killed 12 people on Monday reopened on Thursday, a day after the rest of the city’s markets, but the mood in the city was subdued....
lead_paragraph: The market where an attack killed 12 people on Monday reopened on Thursday, a day after the rest of the city’s markets, but the mood in the city was subdued.

headline.print_headline: Turkey's Erodgan Promises to Continue Fight Against Terrorism
headline.main: Turkey's Erodgan Promises to Continue Fight Against Terrorism

snippet: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan on Sunday said the government would continue its battle against terrorism "until the end", a day after a twin bombing outside an Istanbul soccer stadium killed 38 people....
lead_paragraph: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan on Sunday said the government would continue its battle against terrorism "until the end", a day after a twin bombing outside an Istanbul soccer stadium killed 38 people.
